urls.title: Eye On Calderdale
urls.description: Your one stop website for up to date information about flooding, weather and traffic disruptions across the Borough of Calderdale.

tweets.text:
A flood alert for the upper valley catchment has been issued by @EnvAgencyYNE

Please visit https://t.co/P81ch2DaOL for full details and up to date info.

Partners across @Calderdale monitoring

#floodaware #Todmorden #mytholmroyd #hebdenbridge https://t.co/QFoZrZgUhC
Great to see a Kingfisher in Chester le Street town centre this morning. @EnvAgency and @NorthumbrianH2O have done a great job opening up the burn. https://t.co/u183ALM2AH

There are a number of Flood Alerts in place along the North Sea coast and a Flood Warning for Bridlington.  

Please avoid beaches, promenades and coastal footpaths as strong onshore winds, large waves and seaspray can be dangerous.

For the latest visit 
https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/qh5v4N7wiV
Read more about it! Dunston Beck Improvement Project üíß #environment #agriculture #waterquality #publicgood @beeswaxfarming @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgency https://t.co/dUMKue7zYt

The @EnvAgency has issued a Flood Alert for the upper River Calder catchment.  We're working with partners to check defences, clear debris and will continue to closely monitor the situation. See https://t.co/xwyRorl1or for updates #staysafe and #beprepared https://t.co/3WyUaSLBTe

urls.title: Collection | River & Rowing Museum
urls.description: Donate to the Museum The River & Rowing Museum holds over 20,000 items covering the international sport of rowing, the history of Henley on Thames, the story of the River Thames, the children‚Äôs book The Wind in the Willows and the Modern British artist John Piper. This includes objects, books, ephemera, archival material, artworks and‚Ä¶ Read More

tweets.text: View of the River Thames from the Museum. Don't worry, the #Museum is safe and dry. @EnvAgencySE are recommending we ALL stay safe and dry and don't take your daily exercise along the river bank today.  Enjoy the #Museumfromhome today with a cuppa! https://t.co/9KlprJ0TBB https://t.co/BvlFYDsEfh

Flooding has a devastating impact on  people. So social research is really important. Here is the new #Landscapes2Lifescapes on-line exhibition on how flooding can affect us all at any age. @LancasterUni @UniOfHull @EnvAgency @ESRC https://t.co/hndczjPP1G

U.K. Floods 

We are once again providing sand, sandbags & volunteers to assist the #Colnbrook community with floods defences! 

Over 40 tonnes of sand so far and over 1500 sandbags supplied in total 

@guardianeco @SloughCouncil @AdamAfriyie @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/i9zL5Mxs1P

tweets.text: @AncientTorfaen @ndhags @velohistorian @EnvAgency 7. It‚Äôs possible that they played a role in regulating flooding onto the fields & settlements downstream. But that‚Äôs just a guess. It may be worth checking the archives, once they‚Äôre open again, to see if there is a record of their construction. But .. https://t.co/rWi9QdEYeM
This modelling accounts for some but perhaps not all flood defence schemes, however at the current rate of @EnvAgency spend... ü§î https://t.co/qOvLvsy5KT

@AncientTorfaen @ndhags @velohistorian @EnvAgency 6. Northwards, beyond the bridge, seasonal flooding of low-lying pastures may have been welcomed because it added fertility to the grass & offered an early ‚Äòbite‚Äô to dairy cattle, enriching their yields (as in the fens). So, why the floodgates? https://t.co/7VRAbJFzsA

@AncientTorfaen @ndhags @velohistorian @EnvAgency The reason, of course, is that the area is relatively flat and low-lying. The river valley is quite wide (see lowest contour lines) & the spot heights remain fairly similar across km-long distances (each blue square = 1km sq). https://t.co/TsuXOopFLl

@AncientTorfaen @ndhags @velohistorian @EnvAgency 5. Upstream, just S of the bridge, the river was embanked on both sides in 1900 & then just on one. Embanking cont‚Äôd around the N boundary of the field SW of the bridge. It looks as though flood protection from the river was more important upstream than downstream. https://t.co/T0E7kYeTCG

üì¢ #Greedy developer alertüíµ

To help stop this unnecessary distribution warehouse buildüèóÔ∏è in the countryüå≥ü¶áü¶âüêá damaging creature habitats and destroying the communities of #Melton & #NthFerriby go to the link in @saveferriby2020 tweet below.

Thank youüôè

@FerribyFOCUS https://t.co/F4OJ1hfwZY

tweets.text: @AncientTorfaen @ndhags @velohistorian @EnvAgency 4. Field-names downstream may record that flooding (top R): The Holmes (often: grazing surrounded by marsh) & poss The Rinks (worth checking this name). In the fens it *might* indicate a flooded field iced over in v cold weather. And of course the large area of marsh between them https://t.co/cOYxndQkcM

Our report on #flooding will be published on Monday

In October, @profrichdawson @theCCCuk told us how the emphasis on ‚Äúpreparation, response + recovery‚Äù was an important part of @EnvAgency‚Äôs new ‚Äúresilience‚Äù approach to flood risk

Watch the whole meeting
https://t.co/g0xrgtzeFV https://t.co/vWpgQzEyrb

@AncientTorfaen @ndhags @velohistorian @EnvAgency 3. The geology map confirms the extent of the area that the river appears to have flooded/may still flood: the alluvial silts it has deposited in times of flood are shown in yellow on the map. https://t.co/ys9swfq9bi

Illegal fishing endangers wildlife and fish stocks.

In East Anglia alone, our officers seized 52 illegal nets and traps between March and December last year.

If you see an illegal net or trap let us know by calling 0800 807060.

More info: https://t.co/LXS1yx3Qnm https://t.co/Rqr8TT3zrz

BIG NEWS!
We're proud to announce the National launch of the #Riverfly Extended Scheme. 

#Riverfly #volunteers in #Lincolnshire piloted a scheme designed by @EnvAgencyMids. It was a joint project with @freshwaterbio @dorsetwildlife @riverflies

Info here- https://t.co/Cd4WUHCklp https://t.co/DrLCfPabED
